newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Pasminco eyes zinc smelter expansion.
newsitem.headline: Pasminco eyes zinc smelter expansion.

text.p: Base metals miner Pasminco Ltd said on Wednesday plans to grow the company could include an A$200 million expansion of the Risdon zinc smelter in Tasmania.
However, before the company would consider an expansion, it would need to negotiate with energy authorities in Tasmania over power supplies, a Pasminco spokeswoman said.
The smelter is currently capable of producing about 215,000 tonnes of zinc a year.

Pasminco, which recorded a sharp rise in profits in 1995/96 to A$40.8 million from A$12.2 million in the previous year, was looking at expanding its exisiting operations, which include smelting and mining operations as well making new acquisitions, the spokeswoman said.
An expansion of the Risdon smelter was "one of many things we're looking at," she said.
The company has said a priority was to improve operations in order to better its break-even zinc price.
